com.hv15.aperi.network

Class NetPackage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hv15.aperi.network.NetPackage

  • public class NetPackage
extends Object
    Pseudo-network-packet that contains some information from a WifiP2pDevice object, such as its name, MAC address, and the packet type.

    The types are:

    • REQUEST - indicates that the packet is a request
    • RESPOND - indicates that the packet is a response
    • FLOOD - indicates that the packet containers an IP address
    • DISCONNECT - indicates that a disconnection is about to occur
    Author:
    Hans-Nikolai Viessmann

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DISCONNECT
      Indicates that the sending device is about to disconnect from the group
      static int FLOOD
      The packet contains an IP address, and that this IP address should be used for the response packet
      private String mIP 
      private String mMac 
      private String mName 
      private int mType 
      static int REQUEST
      Used to indicate that the packet is a request, meaning that the sender wishes for the receiver to respond
      static int RESPOND
      Indicates that the packet is a response to a request.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetPackage(String mac)
      This is the constructor to create a delete request packet.
      NetPackage(String mac, String ip)
      This is the constructor to create a flood packet, meaning that it contains meta data about another device such as its MAC and IP address.
      NetPackage(String name, String mac, int type)
      Create a packet
      NetPackage(WifiP2pDevice device, int type)
      Create a packet, having a WifiP2pDevice object parsed for information
